page.title: 01Landscape The Reculver Area
page.content: The Reculver area is quite flat and open and consists mainly of farmland, fields and modern housing. There are no main roads or shopping centre. On the northern side is the Thames Estuary and a beach made up of shingle and mud bordered in parts by high sandy cliffs.Next to the beach is the remains of a Roman fort and Reculver Towers, once a Saxon church but now an ancient monument.The present church is much further inland, rebuilt because the sea was gradually eating away at the land.Bishopstone Manor is so called because it once belonged to the Archbishp of Canterbury. Today it is surrounded by modern housing, most of it built in the last twenty years.The inhabitants are mostly newcomerss to area.
